Literature Review: Tensor networks have revolutionized the field of computational physics, providing a powerful framework for the study of complex many-body systems. Over the past two decades, the development of tensor networks has been driven by the need to tackle the challenges of quantum many-body systems, which are crucial for understanding a wide range of phenomena in physics, chemistry, and materials science. In this review, we will provide an overview of the basic ideas, established methods, and significant algorithmic developments in tensor networks, highlighting their potential and limitations.
